item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, September 17, 2024 at 6:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Fixing an Elgato HD60 S HDMI capture device with the help of Ghidra (52 points | discuss)
2. Why to Not Write a Book (57 points | 37 comments)
3. Chain of Thought Empowers Transformers to Solve Inherently Serial Problems (105 points | 53 comments)
4. FreeBSD 13.4-Release Announcement (92 points | 14 comments)
5. Show HN: Void, an open-source Cursor/GitHub Copilot alternative (38 points | 21 comments)
6. What are the best options for Amazon SDEs thinking about leaving over RTO policy (91 points | 47 comments)
7. Nyxpsi – A Next-Gen Network Protocol for Extreme Packet Loss (117 points | 49 comments)
8. Launch HN: Silurian (YC S24) – Simulate the Earth (272 points | 130 comments)
9. K340A: The Brain Computer of Chernobyl Duga Radar [video] (116 points | 26 comments)
10. Franzelio: Draw Lines. Make Music. Share Your Instrument (58 points | 15 comments)
11. Indiana police are seizing FedEx packages containing cash (217 points | 143 comments)
12. Amazon tells employees to return to office five days a week (1017 points | 1112 comments)
13. Bionicle – my actual part in its origins (2015) (17 points | 2 comments)
14. A Spreadsheet and a Debugger Walk into a Shell (161 points | 7 comments)
15. Master Hexagonal Architecture in Rust (22 points | 9 comments)
16. Dissecting the gzip format (2011) (34 points | 8 comments)
17. A lonely man in his 30s found community in an unlikely place: spin class (53 points | 51 comments)
18. Intel foundry business to make custom chip for Amazon, chipmaker's shares jump (117 points | 41 comments)
19. Mecanum Wheel (38 points | 11 comments)
20. We fine-tuned an LLM to triage and fix insecure code (24 points | 13 comments)
21. 47-year-old Voyager 1 fired up thrusters it hasn't used in decades (33 points | 6 comments)
22. Titan Submersible Marine Board of Investigation (37 points | 11 comments)
23. rainfrog – a database management TUI for Postgres (15 points | 1 comment)
24. Y Combinator is predicated on startups that require low capitalization (126 points | 74 comments)
25. Michigan Micro Mote (M3) makes history as the smallest computer (2015) (19 points | 2 comments)
26. Datomic and Content Addressable Techniques (131 points | 30 comments)
27. The Pragmatic Programmer for Machine Learning (118 points | 18 comments)
28. Intel lost the Sony Playstation business to AMD (194 points | 134 comments)
29. Apple Watch sleep apnea detection gets FDA approval (370 points | 256 comments)
30. Provable Security of Linux-DRBG in the Seedless Robustness Model [pdf] (31 points | 2 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, September 17, 2024 at 6:20 AM UTC
